content.description:
First boulder you get to as you come in the trail off of the road. Its about 100' directly above you.

Has several lines. The main line is a V2 that starts in the lower left side as a sit start, and goes up towards the middle of the top. Couple other harder lines on the right side and middle.
content.protection: Landing is fairly good, but use a spotter to prevent you from over shooting the landing and rolling downhill

content.description: Start on two good crimps, go left to a crimp rail, right to an intermediate credit card crimp then bump right to the sloped feature. Third move was the hardest for me, everything requires lots of foot tension and body positioning. Get high feet and a toe hook out right to move up to the finish. I finished out left as for Shark Tank, you could use good edged out right to topout but itâ€™s sketchy, high, and has a really bad landing.
content.protection: At least two pads, a good spotter would help, if you blow he top, no one can save you.
content.location: Shark tank is the first boulder you see up the hill, gets good sun during the day, nice if you can get a dry winter day. Heat makes it a lot harder.
